title: Drawing, "Venus and Cupid", 1800–15
medium: Red crayon on grey-brown paper over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed: nasita di vener; amore saetatore; amore vincitore.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: In center, circular medallion with Venus shown kneeling in opened shell upon sea. Putti shown beside her. Laterally are pen sketches at left of putto and right of Venus. Cupid dancing holding arrow and bow.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Venus and Cupid", 1800–15.
1800–15. Red crayon on grey-brown paper over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3322.
